definition: to lose money/to pay for damages
to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
surname Qian

sentences.english: Take advantage of every loss to improve your knowledge of mar ket action.
sentences.chinese: 抓住每一次賠錢的機會，改進你對市場行爲的瞭解。

sentences.english: So we're losing money on owning it.
sentences.chinese: 儘管我們有這麼一套房子，卻一直在賠錢。

sentences.english: Jean： But thanks to you guys, government is loosing money because more money needs to be spent to put out the fire.
sentences.chinese: 可多虧了你們，政府也在賠錢。

sentences.english: His firm was losing money and had lost its office lease.
sentences.chinese: 事務所一直在賠錢，已經沒錢再繼續租寫字樓了。

sentences.english: Eventually you will grow to a point where you lose money and your business fails.
sentences.chinese: 最終會到達一個讓你開始賠錢的點，生意就失敗了。

sentences.english: Losses make the speculator studious——not profits.
sentences.chinese: 賠錢不能贏利，但能使投機者細心鑽研。

sentences.english: They thought we would lose money.
Even so, most films lose money in the theaters.
sentences.chinese: 然而即便如此，大多數片子在影院裏是賠錢的。

sentences.english: You just warned me that I could lose money.

definition: to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
to lose a family fortune (idiom)
to make an error
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
unfinished/incomplete
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to bear fruit/CL:個|个[ge4]
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
just in case/if by any chance/contingency
sooner or later
to earn money/moneymaking
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
at that time/originally
bad thing/misdeed/to ruin things
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
